It's official! Chatfield FFA is ranked a 3 Star Chapter by the National FFA Organization for the fourth year in a row! We advanced to Nationals this past spring after receiving the title of 2nd Place Chapter of MN in May. At Nationals, chapters are ranked 1 star, 2 star and 3 stars based on the quality of their Program of Activities. 3 Star is the highest level reserved for programs that exhibit excellence in all of the standards covered in the categories of Growing Leaders, Building Communities and Strengthening Agriculture. It is the highest award that a chapter can receive. We have a lot to be proud of here in Chatfield!

Go Gophers!

Good luck as your app moves forward into this final round!

Great things going on with FFA!

Covid-19 has done a number on the families in our community - especially our farming families. These days farmers are at the mercy of a supply chain that has had its weaknesses exposed and for some, devastation is not a strong enough word. Chatfield FFA has partnered with Kwik Trip to showcase an agricultural commodity each week and donate it to our very own Chatfield Community Food Shelf . Why are we doing this? It is so easy to support our local farmers by purchasing local and buying from companies like Kwik Trip that source their products locally and what could be better than giving to your own community food shelf. Support our local farmers ANY way that you can today and always, without them we cannot eat the products we enjoy. This week we showcase the Dairy Industry and have donated butter to the food shelf and string cheese to our community's backpack program.

~Ms. Fritz

Here are the results from last Friday's Academic Triathlon Meet.

Placing 1st in the Blue Challengers Meet was: Anna Halvorson, Kiara Danielson, Sam Ruskell, Elise Moody and Cayden Meyer.

Receiving a teamwork award in the Pink Challengers Meet was:Eli Kayfes, Simon Erding, Hans Jacobsen, Alaina Armstrong and Dani Severson.

Also participating were: Taylor Ostby, Max Ruskell, Will Boelter, Hannah Tweten and Julia Goldsmith.

For the 7th and 8th graders in the Cross-Trainer Meet, the following kids placed 2nd: Henry Worden, Nick Long, Ella Dammen and Emily Fitzgerald.

Also participating were: Lelani Clifford, Anna Bernau, Jacob Stevens and Brady Irish.
